description: Oksana Lintz, following days of reflection and driven by public outrage over ongoing BCI abuses, decides to release Halden's confidential cache directly to the public. She coordinates the technical release with trusted allies.

The contents of Halden's cache—including internal Council communications, evidence of deliberate score tampering, and details on mass erasures—are posted to major public forums. The revelations confirm deep Council complicity, igniting immediate outrage.

Community leaders, journalists, and citizens gather outside Council offices, demanding resignations, public accountability, and restitution for the Vanished. Several officials are seen fleeing government quarters as crowds swell.

Neighborhood assemblies convene across Stenograd to debate the fate of the BCI system. Proposals range from total dismantling to archiving hardware as evidence of systemic abuse. Makeshift memorials for erased residents appear citywide.
A citywide vigil is held for the Vanished. Former officials and BCI architects publicly admit to system flaws and abuses, while activists call for an open tribunal to decide the city’s new path.
